CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: It is found that PCDSeBT simultaneously has a low - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level at -5.4 eV and a low bandgap of 1.70 eV as required by the ideal polymers for BHJ PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |

The entities in the paragraph are:

* PCDSeBT

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material name", presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |

The entities in the paragraph that do not clearly refer to "Material name" are:

* "HOMO" (which refers to a molecular orbital energy level)
* "Bandgap" (which refers to a property of materials)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Paragraph: It is found that PCDSeBT simultaneously has a low - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level at -5.4 eV and a low bandgap of 1.70 eV as required by the ideal polymers for BHJ PSCs.

| bandgap (energy difference between HOMO and LUMO) |

| --- |

| bandgap (energy difference between HOMO and LUMO) |

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to material properties:

* "PCDSeBT" (which is a chemical compound)
* "ideal polymers" (which is a general term for polymers that meet certain criteria, rather than a specific material property)
